item.title: Meals
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle" css=".vc_custom_1476715326705{margin-top: -7px !important;margin-bottom: 7px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;background-color: #fff9f2 !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1476715371538{margin-right: 60px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;background-image: url(http://smartyschool.stylemixthemes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/placeholder.gif?id=3270) !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="605px"][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1476715391505{padding-top: 51px !important;padding-bottom: 25px !important;padding-left: 10px !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-12" el_class="max-width-540"][stm_title page_title_enable="true" title_margin_b="28px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1476339682176{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"]Full time General Service Manager on site, is responsible for all catering and domestic services within the kindergarten.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1475232694645{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"]A wide selection of freshly made dishes is available at breakfast, lunch and dinner, with a salad bar always offered at lunch and dinner time along with hot and cold vegetarian options.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1475232627061{margin-bottom: 41px !important;}"]Our Managers and Chefs are trained using their own specific training course, so that they understand the company philosophy to produce a food standard that can't be bettered; offering healthy eating with a balance between current eating trends, good nutrition and fresh home-cooked food. Menus rotate on a three weekly cycle.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1475235666292{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 52px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}"][vc_column][stm_meal items_count="2"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces"][vc_column][stm_gallery][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1475233181867{padding-bottom: 30px !important;background-image: url(http://smartyschool.stylemixthemes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/placeholder.gif?id=3980) !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: repeat !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1475233204773{padding-top: 8px !important;}"][stm_call_to_action btn_color="purpure" img_id="3270" btn_link="url:%23|title:Get%20involved||"]Nothing is more important than your child’s well-being. Join our seminars and trainings and learn how to keep it.[/stm_call_to_action][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1474291045708{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_align="center" page_title_enable="true" title_margin_b="0px"][/stm_title][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344536404{margin-bottom: 18px !important;}"]

H1 — Grand Hotel, 60px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344656962{margin-bottom: 55px !important;}"]A liberal arts education at Smart means you can explore what intrigues you or expand your focus to discover something new. How can a materials science approach lead to medical breakthroughs? In this episode of Disruptive, Wyss Core Faculty Member Dave Mooney discusses programmable nanomaterials approaches to fighting disease.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344490588{margin-bottom: 22px !important;padding-top: 4px !important;}"]

H2 — Dosis Medium, 42px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344651455{margin-bottom: 55px !important;}"]Kelsey’s plan for his weekly 90-minute lectures is to bring historical awareness and contextual experience to 13 technologies that have transformed visual communication. He wants students to ask big questions such as: “Why the oil painting — which culture decided it was a good form?” and “How did maps change the way the world was seen?”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344760732{margin-bottom: 23px !important;}"]

H3 — Dosis Medium, 36px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344907258{margin-bottom: 57px !important;}"]Sitting in the Materials Lab in the Smart Art Museums, the freshman holds the pink rubber block firmly in place while pressing a skew chisel along the primate’s pre-printed image. The tool glides into the soft material with ease, and Lu moves quickly to the body.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344824775{margin-bottom: 27px !important;padding-top: 8px !important;}"]

H4 — Dosis SemiBold, 30px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344923731{margin-bottom: 57px !important;}"]“Looking” drew 215 applications for 105 spots this spring, prompting Framework co-creator Robin Kelsey, Shirley Carter Burden Professor of Photography and chair of the Department of History of Art and Architecture, to reflect on its early success.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474344940746{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"]
H5 — Dosis SemiBild, 24px
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474288515714{margin-bottom: 71px !important;}"]“I didn’t expect a lot of hands-on stuff in the class,” said Lu. “I thought I’d only be reading and writing. Being able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be.”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1476351238206{margin-bottom: 18px !important;padding-top: 8px !important;}"]
H6 — Dosis Bold, 18px
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474288544003{margin-bottom: 71px !important;}"]He added, “There’s a tendency in our culture to think that looking is a natural act that requires no training. But looking is structured by technologies, habits, and expectations.”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" el_class="demo-buttons-group" btn_icon_enable="true" btn_icon_fontawesome="stm-icon stm-icon-train"][stm_btn_simple btn_color="yellow" btn_icon_vspace="-3px" btn_icon_hspace="19px" btn_alignment="center" btn_link_text="Disabled State" btn_link="url:%23|||" btn_icon_enable="true" btn_icon_fontawesome="stm-icon stm-icon-train" btn_disabled="true" btn_margin_b="20px"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="41px" md_spacing="41px" !important;}"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="39px" md_spacing="39px" sm_spacing="0px" xs_spacing="0px"][stm_btn_simple btn_style="flat" btn_color="yellow" btn_icon_vspace="-3px" btn_icon_hspace="19px" btn_disabled="true" btn_margin_b="20px"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="41px" md_spacing="41px" sm_spacing="0px" xs_spacing="0px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1474289818652{margin-bottom: 56px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474289665158{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"]

Full width

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474288729359{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]Kelsey’s plan for his weekly 90-minute lectures is to bring historical awareness and contextual experience to 13 technologies that have transformed visual communication. He wants students to ask big questions such as: “Why the oil painting — which culture decided it was a good form?” and “How did maps change the way the world was seen?”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474290138599{margin-bottom: 23px !important;}"]

Two columns

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1474290208059{margin-bottom: 24px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text]The group led by head teaching fellow Matt Gin to the Art Museums on a recent Wednesday was largely made up of science concentrators intent on deepening their understanding of how to look with a critical eye. The session in the Materials Lab built on a recent Kelsey lecture on woodcuts.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text]At the nearby printing table, Adam Jiang hand-rolled a print of his carving. The junior, who is concentrating in biomedical engineering, had broken away from the assigned monkey shape to carve his own design of a penguin, a favorite from family art projects.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474290368163{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"]

Three columns

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1474290443434{margin-bottom: 12px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]Able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be. I thought I’d only be reading and writing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]There’s a tendency in our culture to think that looking is a natural act that requires no training. But looking is structured by technologies, habits, and expectations.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]I guess the texture, I’m not sure. You don’t even have to try much. It’s the same effect of coloring. It’s similar to the adult coloring books all my roommates have.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474290491145{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"]
Four columns
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1474290593315{margin-bottom: 12px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Being able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Jake Hummer found himself captivated by Gustav Kruell’s “Francis James Child,” a woodblock portrait of the Smart scholar.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]After spending a few minutes observing all of the objects, the students picked individual pieces for longer, in-depth study.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]This course gives students a chance to think differently about the visual technologies that permeate their lives.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1474290677069{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"]
Custom layout 3/4 + 1/4
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1453461446393{padding-bottom: 59px !important;}"][vc_column width="3/4"][vc_column_text]That duality — putting art literally into the hands of students while also putting it into historical and experiential context — is at the heart of “The Art of Looking,” and has helped make the class the most popular of the three Framework Courses developed as part of the Humanities Project at Harvard. The courses — “The Art of Listening” and “The Art of Reading” are the others — are in their fourth year.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]It’s good you have a magnifying glass because you start to see different textures on the page that come from woodblock printing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Preparing to Christmas
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Wood Grid Top Box
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This wooden puzzle will keep your little one entertained while teaching them the number one to 10. Each number is depicted with a brightly coloured picture. The durable pieces will withstand the demands of little hands and promote the development of fine motor skills, associations, task completing and independent play. Not suitable for children under the age of 3 years due to small parts which could cause a choking hazard. Order by 3pm for next working day delivery. Applies to all orders Over £29 (excluding large bulky items).
  • Easy for child to combine the puzzle
  • Child can learn about numbers and animals
  • Suitable for ages 3+
  • Assembled Dimensions: 91L x 61W x 0.3H cm
  • Contents: Wooden Floor Puzzle-Number
  • Batteries Not Required
item.excerpt:encoded:
Suitabile for 3 Years +
Assembly Not required
Warning Not suitable for children under the age of 3 years due to small parts which could cause a choking hazard
Delivery Order by 3pm for next working day delivery

item.content:encoded:
This wooden puzzle will keep your little one entertained while teaching them the number one to 10. Each number is depicted with a brightly coloured picture. The durable pieces will withstand the demands of little hands and promote the development of fine motor skills, associations, task completing and independent play. Not suitable for children under the age of 3 years due to small parts which could cause a choking hazard. Order by 3pm for next working day delivery. Applies to all orders Over £29 (excluding large bulky items).
  • Easy for child to combine the puzzle
  • Child can learn about numbers and animals
  • Suitable for ages 3+
  • Assembled Dimensions: 91L x 61W x 0.3H cm
  • Contents: Wooden Floor Puzzle-Number
  • Batteries Not Required

item.title: Testimonials
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1475045269538{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-8"][stm_title page_title_enable="true" title_margin_b="26px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1475038490600{margin-bottom: 42px !important;}"]A few of our families would like to share their experiences with you! Check out our testimonials below![/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038751075{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Tasha Castagna"]Smarty Kindergarten is a great place for my son to start his schooling experience. He loves being there, especially loves Spanish classes with Mrs. Strickland![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038780940{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Jennifer Fitzerald"]My sons have been with Mrs. Miner since they were infants and we are all a big family now! We have always felt like a part of her family and the care our kids have gotten has always been loving and excellent. Our children love being there![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038785722{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Rebekah Donowan"]Mrs. Miner and her staff are phenomenal! My kids have learned so much and have been excelling since starting at Smarty Kindergarten![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038792514{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Sandy Raymond"]The teachers at Smarty go that extra mile to help each child. My son came to the school not being able to say more than a few words. Now, 5 months later, he is talking and even learning to read! Nothing compares to the committment that they show. Thank you teachers![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038797377{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Trisha Kinnaman"]Thank you Smarty for creating such a perfect place for my daughter! She begs to go to Kindergarten every day and is so proud of her accomplishments when I pick her up. We love your Kindergarten![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1475038802291{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][vc_column_inner][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" cite="Utisa Forester"]My son has been going to this Kindergarten since 2015. He loves being at the school! Now he is almost ready to leave for Kindergarten. His skills have progressed well since he's been going there! Mrs. Miner and her staff are very active and attentive. The place is well organized and clean. There is a lot of backyard playground space you could not see from the front office. The service fee is reasonable too! The most important thing is that you can rely on them to leave your little loved on there. Highly recommended![/stm_testimonials][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-4 vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][stm_leave_review form="3928" icon_library="" button_title="Leave a Review" button_sub_title="Let us know your thoughts!" box_title="Leave a Review" css=".vc_custom_1476361892346{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_sidebar sidebar_id="3885"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Oxford Value Bucket of Bricks
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This wooden puzzle will keep your little one entertained while teaching them the number one to 10. Each number is depicted with a brightly coloured picture. The durable pieces will withstand the demands of little hands and promote the development of fine motor skills, associations, task completing and independent play. Not suitable for children under the age of 3 years due to small parts which could cause a choking hazard. Order by 3pm for next working day delivery. Applies to all orders Over £29 (excluding large bulky items).
  • Easy for child to combine the puzzle
  • Child can learn about numbers and animals
  • Suitable for ages 3+
  • Assembled Dimensions: 91L x 61W x 0.3H cm
  • Contents: Wooden Floor Puzzle-Number
  • Batteries Not Required

As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over £1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Mrs. Rondha Smith
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1475218571097{margin-top: -30px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8 vc_col-md-12" css=".vc_custom_1476275362751{padding-bottom: 72px !important;}"][stm_title page_title_enable="true" title_margin_b="27px"]Ms Amanda Eliot is a member of the National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Society for Engineering Education, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. She has received a number of recognitions for her research, teaching, and public service, including seven honorary doctorates and the Benjamin Garver Lamme Medal from the American Society of Engineering Education.[/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1476275355905{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"]B.A. – Human Development and Family Studies, Early Childhood University of California at Sacramento Preschool Lead Teacher at Smarty since 2015[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1475218804860{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]I’ve grown up and currently reside on the middle side of California. I just graduated in May from the University of California at Sacramento with a degree in Human Development and Family Studies, concentrating in Early Childhood Education. I plan to apply for nursing school next fall as I am in pursuit to become a OB/GYN nurse practitioner. I absolutely adore children! I was a babysitter while in college and I also worked at our child development lab. During my spare time I like to blog, shop, and I love movies! I am so excited to be on board here at Smarty. It’s a breath of fresh air![/vc_column_text][stm_teacher_contact_details teacher_address="1485 Byron Street, Palo Alto, CA 94301, USA" teacher_tel="+1 376-546-3287" teacher_skype="michelle.macgilpin" teacher_url="url:m.macgilpin%40smarty.com|title:m.macgilpin%40smarty.com||"][/vc_column][vc_column width="5/12" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" css=".vc_custom_1475642640496{margin-top: 100px !important;}" img_size="446x500" img_responsive_enable="true"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Mrs. Katherine Miner
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1475218571097{margin-top: -30px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8 vc_col-md-12" css=".vc_custom_1476275316967{padding-bottom: 72px !important;}"][stm_title page_title_enable="true" title_margin_b="27px"]Ms Amanda Eliot is a member of the National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Society for Engineering Education, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. She has received a number of recognitions for her research, teaching, and public service, including seven honorary doctorates and the Benjamin Garver Lamme Medal from the American Society of Engineering Education.[/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1476275309336{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"]B.A. – Human Development and Family Studies, Early Childhood University of California at Sacramento Preschool Lead Teacher at Smarty since 2015[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1475218804860{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]I’ve grown up and currently reside on the middle side of California. I just graduated in May from the University of California at Sacramento with a degree in Human Development and Family Studies, concentrating in Early Childhood Education. I plan to apply for nursing school next fall as I am in pursuit to become a OB/GYN nurse practitioner. I absolutely adore children! I was a babysitter while in college and I also worked at our child development lab. During my spare time I like to blog, shop, and I love movies! I am so excited to be on board here at Smarty. It’s a breath of fresh air![/vc_column_text][stm_teacher_contact_details teacher_address="1485 Byron Street, Palo Alto, CA 94301, USA" teacher_tel="+1 376-546-3287" teacher_skype="michelle.macgilpin" teacher_url="url:m.macgilpin%40smarty.com|title:m.macgilpin%40smarty.com||"][/vc_column][vc_column width="5/12" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" css=".vc_custom_1475642464922{margin-top: 100px !important;}" img_size="350x500"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Rosamund Johnson
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Smarty Kindergarten is a great place for my daughter to start her schooling experience. It’s welcoming and safe and my daughter loves being there! This letter is to recognize you and your staff for doing an excellent job teaching my daughter. Her skill level is significantly better since attending Smarty!
